page.title: 20Budleigh Saltertons Heritage
page.content: Suprisingly for such a small town as Salterton there is a thriving{Craft {Centre and Museum}at{Fairlynch House at the end of the High Street.It has lots of things to see such as the {Smugglers Cavern}in the original cellars and the{Lace Exhibition}on the first floor. The house was built in 1810 and it was opened as a museum in 1967.About 8000 people visit Fairlynch each year.The oldest exhibit is a stone age hammer which was made about 22,000 years ago. The house is valued at a quarter of a million pounds and the exhibits are of the same value. The Museum has got copies of the painting of{The Boyhood of Raleigh which was painted by John Millais when he stayed at the Octogon nearby in 1870.
